(I can't let him die just yet he's a favorite of mine.  I will withdraw this 
post if told to do so by one of the moderators.)

::Amperion::
    He was happy now, or would have been if he was awake, that he had taken 
the time to pick up the holographic emitter that had been used to trick him 
in the cave.  He also would have been happy that he had reprogramed it to 
become an image of him centered on the emitter itself.  The final thing was 
pure luck he dropped it in the battle and landed on it when he fell.  It 
turned on and created the hologram over where he was lying.  The first shots 
hit him and dealt significant damage but they also knocked him backwards away 
from the explosions.  The shots dealt less and less damage as the blew him 
farther away.  Because the emitter was centered on his body and small it 
remained functional, moving only slightly.  It also was programmed to hide 
him from sight so that they could not notice that he was no longer getting 
hit.
